articles.title: Long-Running Web Skimming Campaign Steals Credit Cards From Online Checkout Pages
articles.summary: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a major web skimming campaign that has been active since January 2022, targeting several major payment networks like American Express, Diners Club, Discover, JCB Co., Ltd., Mastercard, and UnionPay. "Enterprise organizations that are clients of these payment providers are the most likely to be impacted," Silent Push said in a report published today.

articles.title: Malicious Chrome Extension Steals MEXC API Keys by Masquerading as Trading Tool
articles.summary: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a malicious Google Chrome extension that's capable of stealing API keys associated with MEXC, a centralized cryptocurrency exchange (CEX) available in over 170 countries, while masquerading as a tool to automate trading on the platform. The extension, named MEXC API Automator (ID: pppdfgkfdemgfknfnhpkibbkabhghhfh), has 29 downloads and is still

articles.title: [Webinar] Securing Agentic AI: From MCPs and Tool Access to Shadow API Key Sprawl
articles.summary: AI agents are no longer just writing code. They are executing it. Tools like Copilot, Claude Code, and Codex can now build, test, and deploy software end-to-end in minutes. That speed is reshaping engineering—but it’s also creating a security gap most teams don’t see until something breaks. Behind every agentic workflow sits a layer few organizations are actively securing: Machine Control

articles.title: New Advanced Linux VoidLink Malware Targets Cloud and container Environments
articles.summary: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a previously undocumented and feature-rich malware framework codenamed VoidLink that's specifically designed for long-term, stealthy access to Linux-based cloud environments According to a new report from Check Point Research, the cloud-native Linux malware framework comprises an array of custom loaders, implants, rootkits, and modular

articles.title: What Should We Learn From How Attackers Leveraged AI in 2025?
articles.summary: Old Playbook, New Scale: While defenders are chasing trends, attackers are optimizing the basics The security industry loves talking about "new" threats. AI-powered attacks. Quantum-resistant encryption. Zero-trust architectures. But looking around, it seems like the most effective attacks in 2025 are pretty much the same as they were in 2015. Attackers are exploiting the same entry points that

articles.title: ServiceNow Patches Critical AI Platform Flaw Allowing Unauthenticated User Impersonation
articles.summary: ServiceNow has disclosed details of a now-patched critical security flaw impacting its ServiceNow artificial intelligence (AI) Platform that could enable an unauthenticated user to impersonate another user and perform arbitrary actions as that user. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-12420, carries a CVSS score of 9.3 out of 10.0. It has been codenamed BodySnatcher by AppOmni. "This issue [.

articles.title: New Malware Campaign Delivers Remcos RAT Through Multi-Stage Windows Attack
articles.summary: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of a new campaign dubbed SHADOW#REACTOR that employs an evasive multi-stage attack chain to deliver a commercially available remote administration tool called Remcos RAT and establish persistent, covert remote access. "The infection chain follows a tightly orchestrated execution path: an obfuscated VBS launcher executed via wscript.exe invokes a

articles.title: CISA Warns of Active Exploitation of Gogs Vulnerability Enabling Code Execution
articles.summary: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has warned of active exploitation of a high-severity security flaw impacting Gogs by adding it to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-8110 (CVSS score: 8.7), relates to a case of path traversal in the repository file editor that could result in code execution. "Gogs Path

articles.title: Ukraine's army targeted in new charity-themed malware campaign
articles.summary: Officials of Ukraine's Defense Forces were targeted in a charity-themed campaign between October and December 2025 that delivered backdoor malware called PluggyApe. [...]

articles.title: New VoidLink malware framework targets Linux cloud servers
articles.summary: A newly discovered advanced cloud-native Linux malware framework named VoidLink focuses on cloud environments, providing attackers with custom loaders, implants, rootkits, and plugins designed for modern infrastructures. [...]

articles.title: Central Maine Healthcare breach exposed data of over 145,000 people
articles.summary: A data breach last year at Central Maine Healthcare (CMH) exposed sensitive information of more than 145,000 individuals. [...]

articles.title: Belgian hospital AZ Monica shuts down servers after cyberattack
articles.summary: Belgian hospital AZ Monica was forced to shut down all servers, cancel scheduled procedures, and transfer critical patients earlier today due to a cyberattack. [...]

articles.title: New Windows updates replace expiring Secure Boot certificates
articles.summary: Microsoft has started rolling out new Secure Boot certificates that will automatically install on eligible Windows 11 24H2 and 25H2 systems. [...]

articles.title: Microsoft releases Windows 10 KB5073724 extended security update
articles.summary: Microsoft has released the KB5073724 extended security update to fix the Patch Tuesday security updates, including 3 zero-days and a fix for expiring Secure Boot certificates. [...]

articles.title: Windows 11 KB5074109 & KB5073455 cumulative updates released
articles.summary: Microsoft has released Windows 11 KB5074109 and KB5073455 cumulative updates for versions 25H2/24H2 and 23H2 to fix security vulnerabilities, bugs, and add new features. [...]

articles.title: Microsoft January 2026 Patch Tuesday fixes 3 zero-days, 114 flaws
articles.summary: Today is Microsoft's January 2026 Patch Tuesday with security updates for 114 flaws, including one actively exploited and two publicly disclosed zero-day vulnerabilities. [...]

articles.title: Taiwan Endures Greater Cyber Pressure From China
articles.summary: Chinese cyberattacks on Taiwan's critical infrastructure — including energy utilities and hospitals — rose 6% in 2025, averaging 2.63 million attacks a day.

articles.title: CISO Succession Crisis Highlights How Turnover Amplifies Security Risks
articles.summary: When cybersecurity leadership turns over too fast, risk does not reset. It compounds.

articles.title: 'Most Severe AI Vulnerability to Date' Hits ServiceNow
articles.summary: ServiceNow tacked agentic AI onto a largely unguarded legacy chatbot, exposing customers' data and connected systems.

articles.title: Microsoft Starts 2026 With a Bang: A Freshly Exploited Zero-Day
articles.summary: The vendor's first Patch Tuesday of the year also contains fixes for 112 CVEs, nearly double the amount from last month.

articles.title: Shadow#Reactor Uses Text Files to Deliver Remcos RAT
articles.summary: Attackers use a sophisticated delivery mechanism of text-only files for RAT deployment, showcasing a clever way to bypass defensive tools and rely on the target's own utilities.

articles.title: Attackers Abuse Python, Cloudflare to Deliver AsyncRAT
articles.summary: The phishing campaign shows how attackers continue to weaponize legitimate cloud services and open source tools to evade detection and gain trust.

articles.title: BreachForums Breached, Exposing 324K Cybercriminals
articles.summary: A massive data dump reveals real identities and details of administrators and members of the notorious hacker forum.

articles.title: Multipurpose GoBruteforcer Botnet Targets 50K+ Linux Servers
articles.summary: Researchers detailed a souped-up version of the GoBruteforcer botnet that preys on servers with weak credentials and AI-generated configurations.

articles.title: CrowdStrike to Acquire Browser Security Firm Seraphic for $420 Million
articles.summary: News of the move to acquire Seraphic comes less than a week after CrowdStrike announced an agreement to acquire identity security startup SGNL for $740 million. The post CrowdStrike to Acquire Browser Security Firm Seraphic for $420 Million appeared first on SecurityWeek .

articles.title: Adobe Patches Critical Apache Tika Bug in ColdFusion
articles.summary: Adobe has released patches for 25 vulnerabilities across its products, including a critical Apache Tika flaw in ColdFusion. The post Adobe Patches Critical Apache Tika Bug in ColdFusion appeared first on SecurityWeek .

articles.title: Microsoft Patches Exploited Windows Zero-Day, 111 Other Vulnerabilities
articles.summary: Two vulnerabilities patched this month by Microsoft were disclosed publicly before fixes were released. The post Microsoft Patches Exploited Windows Zero-Day, 111 Other Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek .

articles.title: GoBruteforcer Botnet Targeting Crypto, Blockchain Projects
articles.summary: The botnet’s propagation is fueled by the AI-generated server deployments that use weak credentials, and legacy web stacks. The post GoBruteforcer Botnet Targeting Crypto, Blockchain Projects appeared first on SecurityWeek .

articles.title: After Goldman, JPMorgan Discloses Law Firm Data Breach
articles.summary: The law firm Fried Frank seems to be informing high-profile clients about a recent data security incident. The post After Goldman, JPMorgan Discloses Law Firm Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek .

articles.title: Cyber Insights 2026: External Attack Surface Management
articles.summary: AI will assist companies in finding their external attack surface, but it will also assist bad actors in locating and attacking the weak points. The post Cyber Insights 2026: External Attack Surface Management appeared first on SecurityWeek .

articles.title: Broadcom Wi-Fi Chipset Flaw Allows Hackers to Disrupt Networks
articles.summary: The vulnerability was discovered in Asus routers, but all devices using the affected chipset are susceptible to attacks. The post Broadcom Wi-Fi Chipset Flaw Allows Hackers to Disrupt Networks appeared first on SecurityWeek .

articles.title: SAP’s January 2026 Security Updates Patch Critical Vulnerabilities
articles.summary: SAP has released 17 security notes, including four that address critical SQL injection, RCE, and code injection vulnerabilities. The post SAP’s January 2026 Security Updates Patch Critical Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek .

articles.title: Student Loan Breach Exposes 2.5M Records
articles.summary: 2.5 million people were affected, in a breach that could spell more trouble down the line.

articles.title: Watering Hole Attacks Push ScanBox Keylogger
articles.summary: Researchers uncover a watering hole attack likely carried out by APT TA423, which attempts to plant the ScanBox JavaScript-based reconnaissance tool.

articles.title: Tentacles of ‘0ktapus’ Threat Group Victimize 130 Firms
articles.summary: Over 130 companies tangled in sprawling phishing campaign that spoofed a multi-factor authentication system.

articles.title: Ransomware Attacks are on the Rise
articles.summary: Lockbit is by far this summer’s most prolific ransomware group, trailed by two offshoots of the Conti group.

articles.title: Cybercriminals Are Selling Access to Chinese Surveillance Cameras
articles.summary: Tens of thousands of cameras have failed to patch a critical, 11-month-old CVE, leaving thousands of organizations exposed.

articles.title: Twitter Whistleblower Complaint: The TL;DR Version
articles.summary: Twitter is blasted for security and privacy lapses by the company’s former head of security who alleges the social media giant’s actions amount to a national security risk.

articles.title: Firewall Bug Under Active Attack Triggers CISA Warning
articles.summary: CISA is warning that Palo Alto Networks’ PAN-OS is under active attack and needs to be patched ASAP.

articles.title: Fake Reservation Links Prey on Weary Travelers
articles.summary: Fake travel reservations are exacting more pain from the travel weary, already dealing with the misery of canceled flights and overbooked hotels.

articles.title: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
articles.summary: CISA has added one new vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog , based on evidence of active exploitation. CVE-2026-20805 Microsoft Windows Information Disclosure Vulnerability This type of vulnerability is a frequent attack vector for malicious cyber actors and poses significant risks to the federal enterprise.
